summary: This is a Victim Notification System (VNS) email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, notifying a victim identified by the last name 'Jackson' about the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein. It outlines victim rights, provides details of an upcoming detention hearing, and lists the lead prosecutors on the case.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, whose office is prosecuting the case and who signed the victim notification letter.

events.title: Detention Hearing for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A hearing before Judge Richard Berman scheduled for 10:00 AM at Courtroom 17B, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY, regarding the detention or release of defendant Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: One St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Courtroom 17B, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and federally charged under 'Project Safe Childhood' by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (Case Number 2018R01618, Docket 19-CR-00490).
The document is a victim notification sent to an individual with the last name 'Jackson', who was identified by law enforcement as a victim or potential victim in the Epstein investigation.
The lead prosecutors on the case are explicitly named as Maurene Comey, Alexander Rossmiller, and Alison Moe.
A detention hearing for Epstein was scheduled for July 15, 2019, before Judge Richard Berman.
The notification details the rights of victims under the Crime Victims' Rights Act and the Victims' Rights and Restitution Act.
